subject: Athletics and Sports
lead_paragraph: Athletes who have served suspensions for major doping offenses will not be invited to compete at major European meets, a top organizer said. “It is a message to the new generation: ‘Stay off doping. And if you don’t, don’t come looking here,’ ” said Wilfried Meert, organizer of the Van Damme Golden League meet in Brussels. Meert said organizers would adhere to the policy even in the face of legal challenges. The measure has been adopted by organizers of Europe’s 51 major invitational meets, including all the Golden League and Grand Prix events, and applies to athletes who have been barred for two years.
